main event: Five moving objects were observed over Hastings, Michigan on July 12, 1957. The objects were described as bright, silver and round in shape, and moved off to the north followed by a jet aircraft that chased them.
interesting points: The first object was observed at 2050Z, moving northeast.
The second object rapidly ascended and disappeared after being observed traveling northeast.
The remaining four objects moved off to the north followed by a jet aircraft.
The objects were observed for 5-10 minutes.
A separate sighting on July 6, 1957 described a luminous, disc-shaped object with blinking lights that was observed for 10-15 minutes over Hastings, Michigan.
sighted object: Five bright, silver, round objects and a luminous, disc-shaped object
